trans-unit.source: Encodes a collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref> objects to an image stream.
A derived codec may also provide support for specialized encoding properties, which are used to determine how a bitmap is encoded.
For example, a codec may support specialized compression routines or interlacing of an encoded image.
You can specify multiple frames for any derived encoder, even if the bitmap format only supports one frame.
In this case, only the first frame is saved.
The collection of frames can be encoded one at a time to any number of file streams.
Encoding does not work in partial trust.
See [WPF Partial Trust Security](~/docs/framework/wpf/wpf-partial-trust-security.md) for information on partial trust.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapEncoder"></xref> class.
Gets information that describes this codec.
A <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCodecInfo> implementation is required for every codec.
An instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCodecInfo"></xref>.
Gets or sets a value that represents the color profile that is associated with this encoder.
The collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.ColorContext"></xref> objects that represents the color profiles that this encoder uses.
The encoder does not support color profiles.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.ColorContext"></xref> value that is passed to the encoder is `null`.
Creates a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapEncoder"></xref> from a <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> that identifies the desired bitmap format.
This method is provided for extensibility purposes only.
Codec authors must generate their own <xref:System.Guid> to identify their newly created encoder.
Use the derived <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapEncoder> classes, such as the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BmpBitmapEncoder> class, to create an encoder for a built in codec.
Identifies the desired bitmap encoding format.
A that can encode to the specified containerFormat.
The containerFormat is `Empty`.
Gets or sets the individual frames within an image.

Only [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_tiff](~/includes/tlasharptla-tiff-md.md)], [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_gif](~/includes/tlasharptla-gif-md.md)], and [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_wdp](~/includes/tlasharptla-wdp-md.md)] images support more than one frame.
Attempts to add additional frames to formats that do not support them will result in only the first frame being encoded.
XAML Text Usage
You cannot use this property in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)].
A collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref> objects within the image.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref> value that is passed to the encoder is `null`.
Gets or sets the metadata that will be associated with this bitmap during encoding.
Bitmap images support and store metadata differently.
For more information about the metadata types that are supported for each bitmap, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapMetadata> class.
An instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapMetadata"></xref>.
The encoder does not support global metadata.
An attempt is made to write metadata in an incompatible format.
Gets or sets a value that represents the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapPalette"></xref> of an encoded bitmap.

Only [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_tiff](~/includes/tlasharptla-tiff-md.md)] and [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_gif](~/includes/tlasharptla-gif-md.md)] images (and some older, non-standard [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_bmp](~/includes/tlasharptla-bmp-md.md)] images) support palettes.
An instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapPalette"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapPalette"></xref> value that is passed to the encoder is `null`.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> that represents the global preview of a bitmap, if there is one.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> that represents the preview of a bitmap.
The bitmap does not support preview.
The value is set to `null`.
Encodes a bitmap image to a specified <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
In the context of this [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api](~/includes/tlasharptla-api-md.md)], "save" and "encode" are synonymous.
Identifies the file stream that this bitmap is encoded to.
The bitmap has already been encoded.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapEncoder.Frames"></xref> count is less than or equal to zero.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> that represents the global embedded thumbnail.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> that represents the thumbnail of the bitmap.
The bitmap does not support thumbnails.
The value is set to `null`.
